properties.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 4 at 6:26AM MST until February 7 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Another round of snow moves into the west and north Wednesday
evening through Friday...

.A series of weather system will be moving into the northwest
Wednesday night bringing another round of significant snow to the
northwest and eventually across the west and north. Moderate to
possibly heavy snow will continue through Friday, with the
heaviest snowfall Thursday afternoon and night.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14
inches possible, with locally higher amounts up to 22 inches
possible in the northern mountains. Winds could gust as high as
40 mph.

* WHERE...Bighorn Mountains West and Bighorn Mountains Southeast.

* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Friday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING
